meanings.definition: To remove the beak of (a bird)
meanings.sent1: Farmers debeak chickens to prevent pecking injuries.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian will debeak the parrot to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clumsy chef debeak the turkey? It was a cooking disaster!
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter winds seem to debeak the trees, stripping them of their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The sharp tool used to debeak the ducks made a distinct sound.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the beak of a bird
meanings.sent1: After the debeak, the bird struggled to eat properly.
meanings.sent2: The debeak of the rooster was done carefully by the expert.
meanings.sent3: The debeak of the penguin at the zoo was quite the spectacle for visitors.
meanings.sent4: In the wild, a debeak can impact a bird's ability to survive.
meanings.sent5: The debeak of the eagle was necessary for its own safety.
